title: Disney+ to Roll Out Cheaper, Ad-Supported Subscription in Late 2022; Walt Disney didn't disclose pricing details; streaming service currently costs $7.99 a month
text:
The company didn't share pricing details for the ad-supported subscription, or say when exactly it will launch. Disney+ currently costs $7.99 a month.

The company said the new offering is a building block in Disney's goal to gain 230 million to 260 million Disney+ subscribers by fiscal 2024.

Disney-owned Hulu already offers an ad-supported version at $6.99 a month, compared with $12.99 a month for no ads.

Write to Will Feuer at will.feuer@wsj.com

Disney+ to Roll Out Cheaper, Ad-Supported Subscription in Late 2022
